meterbay, im not sure what you mean, but if your wondering how to scrub iso;s use wiiscrubber 1.4 kit. i personally use the trim option, but i dont think trimmed iso work for disk backups, but work 100% in usb loaders trimming an iso cuts out the blank data and the update data, only leaving the data partition on the iso. this  makes it so the iso is not 4 gigs, but rather the size it takes up on a WBFS partition.

at people getting update requests: Don't update.  you're supposed to be using a backup launcher to play these.  otherwise your Wii will become bricked upon update.

I run bannerbomb - Ok, 
run Bootmii as boot2 - Ok backup NAND - OK
run Wehackwii package - IOS 249 and Trucha bug restorer.

to further clarify my question...i will also add that i tried all disk loaders and i only get half the games to work on them.i made my own loader that auto loads any region automatically from a chanel.this is the only game so far that wont work out of about 100...but the iso is flawless except for the new error 002...nice work!

Well forgottensouls, there was some improvement with the sound now, but there is still one problem, when i enter a game like teamdeathmatch, when the countdown timer reaches 0 the screen goes black for about a few seconds before i start the game. And when i die, the screen goes black for about 5 seconds before i come back, i thought it was normal until i went to search and destroy. When the mach would start, the screen would go black for about 6 seconds, and when i come back, my team already took the bomb and already in their positions, so its impossible for me to get the bomb, any way i can fix this?

yashar0 I honestly don't know what to tell you.  being more of a 360 online player than Wii due to the FC factor, I haven't played online yet.  But what that sounds like is more of a network issue.  it just means you connected a little later.  thats all.  no big deal.  at least to me.

Well, i found out that its because its a cracked CD that the respawn times are slower, i have to use a USB flash drive loader, unfortunatly my Flash Drive is only 3.72gb, and the game is 4.72gb (.iso) FML

Will this work for +R dvds?  Cause all the games i had tried to play doesnt read in my CD Drive on my Wii.  I also have the newer Wii and i read on some site they wont read burned DVDs anymore.  Can some help me please!!!

@jm815

What you read is true. New Wiis won't read burned DVDs. You have to use an external HDD or USB.
can this game be played online??

The game works just perfectly with USBLoader GX and cIOS 224. PAL users can play it with Force PAL 50 on USBLoader's options.

And YES you can play on multiplayer mode!
